snippet: A lawyer who called himself a philanthropist was sentenced to six years in a fraud case in which he cost insurance companies and bond insurers $46 million, a judge said.
abstract: Joseph Caramadre, lawyer who called himself a philanthropist, is sentenced to six years in fraud case in which he cost insurance companies and bond insurers $46 million; federal prosecutors contend that Caramadre was a scam artist, preying on the ill and dying.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer who called himself a philanthropist was sentenced to six years in a fraud case in which he cost insurance companies and bond insurers $46 million, a judge said.

headline.main: Prison for Rhode Island Lawyer in Tale of Insurance and Death
headline.print_headline: Prison for Rhode Island Lawyer In Tale of Insurance and Death
